subject: this is about tiktok shop update
content:
Hi [First Name],

I noticed [Brand Name] is on TikTok Shop – great move! But I also see most brands in your niche are leaving 20-40% more sales on the table by not optimizing for TikTok’s algorithm.

Quick intro: I’m [Your Name] from [Your Company]. We’ve helped brands like [Similar Brand] 3X their TikTok Shop revenue in under 90 days by fixing 3 key issues:
1️⃣ Underperforming creatives (even great products flop with wrong hooks)
2️⃣ Inefficient ad spend (burning cash on broad targeting)
3️⃣ Weak conversion flows (traffic ≠ sales)

Here’s what we could do for you:
✅ Free TikTok Shop Audit (we’ll pinpoint your biggest revenue leaks)
✅ Data-backed strategy session (15 mins)
✅ Case studies from your niche

Are you open to a quick call this week? No pitch – just actionable insights.

Best,
[Your Full Name]
[Your Position] | [Your Company]
📞 [Phone] | 🌐 [Website]
[Your Email]

P.S. Example: [Competitor Brand] saw a 217% ROI increase after fixing these same issues. We’d love to help you replicate that.

subject: tiktok shop testing
content:
Of course! Here's a clear summary of what we’re doing — you can copy and paste this into another ChatGPT if needed:

✅ Project Summary
I'm building a simple Email Scheduler Tool using HTML (frontend) and Node.js (backend with Nodemailer).
It allows users to:

Send emails instantly, or

Schedule emails for later.

The system includes:

A basic frontend in index.html for the form.

A backend in server.js using Express and Nodemailer.

Scheduled emails are stored in emails.json and sent using node-cron.

🛠️ Project Structure
pgsql
Copy
Edit
emailtool/
│
├── index.html          ← Frontend UI
├── server.js           ← Backend server
├── emails.json         ← Stores scheduled emails
├── package.json        ← Node dependencies
├── node_modules/       ← Installed npm packages
🔄 What We’re Doing Now
We are:

Running the backend using node server.js

Serving the frontend using npx http-server

Testing if emails can be sent or scheduled

Debugging connection issues between the frontend and backend

Let me know if you want me to export this as a file or improve it!
